kaprekar

Class Kaprekar

  • java.lang.Object
    • kaprekar.Kaprekar

  • public class Kaprekar
extends java.lang.Object
    Takes a digit consisting of at most 4 numbers, and outputs how many times Kaprekar's Routine must be performed on it before Kaprekar's Constant is hit. Also outputs other the max number of iterations possible and how many numbers require a certain amount of iterations if the user wants to know. Idea from https://www.reddit.com/r/dailyprogrammer/comments/56tbds/20161010_challenge_287_easy_kaprekars_routine/

      • largestNum

        public static int largestNum(int digit)
        Finds the largest number in a digit (so the output for 1234 would be 4, and the output for 3271 would be 7). The initial challenge that was just a warmup for the actual program
        Parameters:
        digit - The input digit
        Returns:
        The largest number in the digit

      • orderedDigit

        public static int orderedDigit(int digit,
                               java.lang.String direction)
        Orders the array of digits and turns the array back into a single number (going in order, so {1, 2, 3} would become 123).
        Parameters:
        digit - The digit to be ordered based on the numbers it is composed of
        direction - The direction of the ordering
        Returns:
        An ordered number based on whether the user wanted it ordered ascending or descending
